sudoku

Class SudokuSolver

  • java.lang.Object
    • sudoku.SudokuSolver

  • public class SudokuSolver
extends java.lang.Object
    The SudokuSolver create a full valid sudoku game for an empty table Resolves Sudoku for a table which is not empty
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Cudelcu Valentin Emil

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      SudokuSolver()
      Default constructor for SudokuGame Initializes the private variables Call the addNums method

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addCellIndexesPair(int row, int col)
      Adds the row and col indexes of the last removed cell if the cell was removed and sudoku is still unique
      boolean createValidSudoku(int row, int col)
      Creates a full valid sudoku using an empty table allowedNums array is every time shuffled It helps to avoid creating the same sudoku again
      java.util.List<CellIndexesPair> getRemovedCells()
      Returns the list of indexes of the removed cells
      int[][] getSolverValues()
      Returns the solver values (a full valid sudoku table)
      boolean solveSudoku(int[][] values, int forbiddenNum, int row, int col, int index)
      Resolve sudoku using backtracking algorithm Tries to make a new sudoku for the values array Fills the last removed cell and then fills the cells from the removedCells array

    • Method Detail

      • solveSudoku

        public boolean solveSudoku(int[][] values,
                           int forbiddenNum,
                           int row,
                           int col,
                           int index)
        Resolve sudoku using backtracking algorithm Tries to make a new sudoku for the values array Fills the last removed cell and then fills the cells from the removedCells array
        Parameters:
        values - - Two-Dimensional array (not empty) which is used to create another valid sudoku
        forbiddenNum - - number which cannot be used in the last removed cell
        row - row of the last removed cell value
        col - col of the last removed col value
        index - index of the CellIndexesPair array (starts at -1)
        Returns:
        TRUE if a new valid Sudoku found, otherwise FALSE
        See Also:
        SudokuGenerator.generateSudoku()

      • addCellIndexesPair

        public void addCellIndexesPair(int row,
                               int col)
        Adds the row and col indexes of the last removed cell if the cell was removed and sudoku is still unique
        Parameters:
        row - row of the last removed cell
        col - col of the last removed cell

      • createValidSudoku

        public boolean createValidSudoku(int row,
                                 int col)
        Creates a full valid sudoku using an empty table allowedNums array is every time shuffled It helps to avoid creating the same sudoku again
        Parameters:
        row - row used in backtracking algorithm to fill the table
        col - col used in backtracking algorithm to fill the table
        Returns:
        TRUE if the sudoku was created, otherwise FALSE

      • getSolverValues

        public int[][] getSolverValues()
        Returns the solver values (a full valid sudoku table)
        Returns:
        int[][]

      • getRemovedCells

        public java.util.List<CellIndexesPair> getRemovedCells()
        Returns the list of indexes of the removed cells
        Returns:
        int[][]
